text: Excoecaria oppositifolia, an understory and evergreen tree species, belongs to the genus Excoecaria of the family Euphorbiaceae. It is found in Western Ghats of India and Sri Lanka. Trees are tall and leaves are simple and decussate in nature. Unisexual flowers are dioecious and inflorescence depends on the type of flower. Male flowers are axillary spikes and female flowers are axillary racemes. ==References== ==Further reading== *India biodiversity ==External links== * Improved access to highly unsaturated skin irritants of the daphnane type from latex of Excoecaria oppositifolia. *FDA Poisonous Plant Database oppositifolia Category:Flora of Asia Category:Flora of Sri Lanka
title: Excoecaria oppositifolia
